etymology.description: Originally borrowed from 束(束) (shù, 'bundle') for sound similarity with 橐(橐) (tuó, 'bag') -> a horizontal stroke added to differentiate 東(東) (dōng, 'east') -> final form
etymology.interpretation: 東(東) (dōng) was adapted from existing characters to convey its phonetic sound. It was visually modified to create a unique form, aiding differentiation from related or sound-alike characters.

examples.chinese: 我买了个新東(我買了個新東)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le gè xīn dōng.

examples.chinese: 他把東放在桌上(他把東放在桌上)，准备去旅行(準備去旅行)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ dōng fàng zài zhuō shàng, zhǔnbèi qù lǚxíng.
examples.english: He put the bag on the table, preparing to travel.
